fields.Title: Re-Thinking E-Learning Research: Foundations, Methods and Practices
fields.Description/Abstract: In the rapidly-changing world of the Internet and the Web, theory and research struggle to keep up with technological, social, and economic developments. In education in particular, a proliferation of novel practices, applications, and formsfrom bulletin boards to Webcasts, from online educational games to open educational resourceshave come to be addressed under the rubric of e-learning. In response to these phenomena, Re-thinking E-Learning Research introduces a number of research frameworks and methodologies relevant to e-learning
